messages.content: You are a helpful assistant.
What will happen to a player's investigator if they fail a CON roll?
Their investigator will take 1D3 damage.
You are a helpful assistant.
How will a player's hit points be affected if they fail a CON roll?
Their hit points will be used to track failure.
You are a helpful assistant.
What will happen to an investigator's hit points if they fall to zero?
They will be unconscious and facing imminent death.
You are a helpful assistant.
Why is consistency in characteristic generation important?
Players expect consistency and should be applied equally for all players.
You are a helpful assistant.
What should you do if you allow one player to re-roll or juggle characteristics?
You should be up front about it and apply the same approach for all players.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is an effective way to maintain control in scenes involving multiple investigators?
You should quickly establish a list of investigators and non-player characters in DEX order.
You are a helpful assistant.
How should you resolve actions in a scene?
Start with the highest DEX (at the top of the list) and resolve that character’s action, then work down the list in turn.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the condition to end a round?
When everyone has had their turn.
You are a helpful assistant.
How do players resolve their actions in a round?
Players resolve their actions in a round by starting with the character with the highest DEX and then working down the list in turn.
You are a helpful assistant.
How long does it take to pick a lock in this scenario?
It takes 3 combat rounds to pick the lock, but it may take more if the roll is pushed.
You are a helpful assistant.
Why does the Keeper set the time for picking a lock?
The Keeper sets the time for picking a lock because some actions take longer to perform than others, and the rules define how long it may take for specific actions.
You are a helpful assistant.
What happens when everyone has had their turn in a round?
The round is over when everyone has had their turn.
You are a helpful assistant.
How long does it take to pick a lock according to the Keeper's rules?
3 combat rounds
You are a helpful assistant.
What should a Keeper balance when making judgments about in-game events?
A sense of reality with what will create a dramatic situation
You are a helpful assistant.
What phrase should a Keeper use to justify universally undesirable events?
But that's how it works in reality
You are a helpful assistant.
Should a Keeper strive to be realistic in their judgments, or be more creative?
More creative
You are a helpful assistant.
How many combat rounds does the Keeper rule will take to pick a lock?
3 combat rounds
You are a helpful assistant.
How far can a character travel per movement point in one combat round?
One meter or yard per movement point (MOV)
You are a helpful assistant.
How far can an average human travel in one combat round?
8 meters
You are a helpful assistant.
If a character is sprinting, how many times can they cover the distance of one combat round?
Five times
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the standard approach to measuring distances in a combat scenario?
Movement distances are approximate and based on narrative description.
You are a helpful assistant.
How far can a character typically travel in one combat round?
A character can cautiously travel 1 meter or 1 yard per movement point (MOV) in one combat round.
You are a helpful assistant.
What is the maximum distance an average human can travel in one combat round while sprinting?
An average human can travel 5 times the distance (5 meters) in one combat round while sprinting.
You are a helpful assistant.
Should non-player characters be given standard damage rules?
Yes, non-player characters should use the standard damage rules.
